Header: Messi close to return as Barca head to Inter in Champions League
Content: Barcelona head coach Ernesto Valverde said in a news conference that captain Lionel Messi could feature in Today’s Champions League match at Inter Milan, little more than two weeks after breaking his arm. Messi was a surprise inclusion in the squad as he was expected to be out of action for three weeks after breaking a bone in his right arm on October 20th . The Argentine forward returned to training last week and may be able to help Barcelona secure progression from Group B at the San Siro, Milan, Italy. Valverde’s side trained in the afternoon, after which Messi may receive his medical clearance from Barcelona’s doctors.
